p: Phytochemical analysis and total tannin quantification of the extracts from the three plant samples were performed and the result indicated that R. glutinosa showed the highest tannin content and A. gumifera the least ( Table 1). Meanwhile, the results of mean inhibition percentage (Â±SD) of condensed tannin-enriched extracts ( Tables 2 and 3) showed that all three condensed tannin extracts demonstrated various degrees of dose-dependent inhibition on both egg hatchability and larval development, with R. glutinosa being the highest followed by S. guineensa, whereas A. gumifera showed the lowest inhibition.
